00235 /**************************************************************************/
00240 static const uint16_t EFM_Numbers[] = {
00241   0x003f, /* 0 */
00242   0x0006, /* 1 */
00243   0x005b, /* 2 */
00244   0x004f, /* 3 */
00245   0x0066, /* 4 */
00246   0x006d, /* 5 */
00247   0x007d, /* 6 */
00248   0x0007, /* 7 */
00249   0x007f, /* 8 */
00250   0x006f, /* 9 */
00251   0x0077, /* A */
00252   0x007c, /* b */
00253   0x0027, /* C */
00254   0x005e, /* d */
00255   0x0079, /* E */
00256   0x0071, /* F */
00257   0x0040  /* - */
00258 };
00259 
00261 /* sign is last element of the table  */
00262 static const uint16_t signIndex = sizeof(EFM_Numbers)/sizeof(uint16_t) - 1 ;
00263 
00264 static const LCD_Init_TypeDef lcdInit = LCD_INIT_DEF;
00267 /**************************************************************************/
00271 void SegmentLCD_UnsignedHex(uint16_t value)
00272 {
00273   int      num, i, com, bit, digit;
00274   uint16_t bitpattern;
00275 
00276   /* Parameter consistancy check */
00277   if (value >= 0xffff)
00278   {
00279     value = 0xffff;
00280   }
00281 
00282   /* If an update is in progress we must block, or there might be tearing */
00283   LCD_SyncBusyDelay(0xFFFFFFFF);
00284 
00285   /* Freeze updates to avoid partial refresh of display */
00286   LCD_FreezeEnable(true);
00287 
00288   /* Turn off all number LCD segments */
00289   SegmentLCD_NumberOff();
00290 
00291   for (digit = 0; digit < 4; digit++)
00292   {
00293     num        = (value >> (4 * digit)) & 0x0f;
00294     bitpattern = EFM_Numbers[num];
00295     for (i = 0; i < 7; i++)
00296     {
00297       bit = EFM_Display.Number[digit].bit[i];
00298       com = EFM_Display.Number[digit].com[i];
00299       if (bitpattern & (1 << i))
00300       {
00301         LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00302       }
00303     }
00304   }
00305 
00306   /* Sync LCD registers to LE domain */
00307   LCD_FreezeEnable(false);
00308 }
00309 
00310 /**************************************************************************/
00314 void SegmentLCD_Number(int value)
00315 {
00316   int      i, com, bit, digit, div, neg;
00317   uint16_t bitpattern;
00318   uint16_t num;
00319 
00320   /* Parameter consistancy check */
00321   if (value >= 9999)
00322   {
00323     value = 9999;
00324   }
00325   if (value <= -1000)
00326   {
00327     value = -999;
00328   }
00329   if (value < 0)
00330   {
00331     value = abs(value);
00332     neg   = 1;
00333   }
00334   else
00335   {
00336     neg = 0;
00337   }
00338 
00339   /* If an update is in progress we must block, or there might be tearing */
00340   LCD_SyncBusyDelay(0xFFFFFFFF);
00341 
00342   /* Freeze updates to avoid partial refresh of display */
00343   LCD_FreezeEnable(true);
00344 
00345   /* Turn off all number LCD segments */
00346   SegmentLCD_NumberOff();
00347 
00348   /* Extract useful digits */
00349   div = 1;
00350   for (digit = 0; digit < 4; digit++)
00351   {
00352     num = (value / div) % 10;
00353     if ((neg == 1) && (digit == 3)) num = signIndex;
00354     /* Get number layout of display */
00355     bitpattern = EFM_Numbers[num];
00356     for (i = 0; i < 7; i++)
00357     {
00358       bit = EFM_Display.Number[digit].bit[i];
00359       com = EFM_Display.Number[digit].com[i];
00360       if (bitpattern & (1 << i))
00361       {
00362         LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00363       }
00364     }
00365     div = div * 10;
00366   }
00367   /* Sync LCD registers to LE domain */
00368   LCD_FreezeEnable(false);
00369 }

00378   LCD_NUMBER_OFF();
00379   return;
00380 }

00392 /**************************************************************************/
00396 void SegmentLCD_Write(char *string)
00397 {
00398   int      data, length, index;
00399   uint16_t bitfield;
00400   uint32_t com, bit;
00401   int      i;
00402 
00403   length = strlen(string);
00404   index  = 0;
00405 
00406   /* If an update is in progress we must block, or there might be tearing */
00407   LCD_SyncBusyDelay(0xFFFFFFFF);
00408 
00409   /* Freeze LCD to avoid partial updates */
00410   LCD_FreezeEnable(true);
00411 
00412   /* Turn all segments off */
00413   SegmentLCD_AlphaNumberOff();
00414 
00415   /* Fill out all characters on display */
00416   for (index = 0; index < 7; index++)
00417   {
00418     if (index < length)
00419     {
00420       data = (int) *string;
00421     }
00422     else           /* Padding with space */
00423     {
00424       data = 0x20; /* SPACE */
00425     }
00426     /* Defined letters currently starts at "SPACE" - ASCII 0x20; */
00427     data = data - 0x20;
00428     /* Get font for this letter */
00429     bitfield = EFM_Alphabet[data];
00430 
00431     for (i = 0; i < 14; i++)
00432     {
00433       bit = EFM_Display.Text[index].bit[i];
00434       com = EFM_Display.Text[index].com[i];
00435 
00436       if (bitfield & (1 << i))
00437       {
00438         /* Turn on segment */
00439         LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00440       }
00441     }
00442     string++;
00443   }
00444   /* Enable update */
00445   LCD_FreezeEnable(false);
00446 }

00468 /**************************************************************************/
00473 void SegmentLCD_EnergyMode(int em, int on)
00474 {
00475   uint32_t com, bit;
00476 
00477   com = EFM_Display.EMode.com[em];
00478   bit = EFM_Display.EMode.bit[em];
00479 
00480   if (on)
00481   {
00482     LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00483   }
00484   else
00485   {
00486     LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, false);
00487   }
00488 }

00514 /**************************************************************************/
00519 void SegmentLCD_Symbol(lcdSymbol s, int on)
00520 {
00521   int com = 0;
00522   int bit = 0;
00523 
00524   switch (s)
00525   {
00526   case LCD_SYMBOL_GECKO:
00527     com = LCD_SYMBOL_GECKO_COM;
00528     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_GECKO_SEG;
00529     break;
00530   case LCD_SYMBOL_ANT:
00531     com = LCD_SYMBOL_ANT_COM;
00532     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_ANT_SEG;
00533     break;
00534   case LCD_SYMBOL_PAD0:
00535     com = LCD_SYMBOL_PAD0_COM;
00536     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_PAD0_SEG;
00537     break;
00538   case LCD_SYMBOL_PAD1:
00539     com = LCD_SYMBOL_PAD1_COM;
00540     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_PAD1_SEG;
00541     break;
00542   case LCD_SYMBOL_EFM32:
00543     com = LCD_SYMBOL_EFM32_COM;
00544     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_EFM32_SEG;
00545     break;
00546   case LCD_SYMBOL_MINUS:
00547     com = LCD_SYMBOL_MINUS_COM;
00548     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_MINUS_SEG;
00549     break;
00550   case LCD_SYMBOL_COL3:
00551     com = LCD_SYMBOL_COL3_COM;
00552     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_COL3_SEG;
00553     break;
00554   case LCD_SYMBOL_COL5:
00555     com = LCD_SYMBOL_COL5_COM;
00556     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_COL5_SEG;
00557     break;
00558   case LCD_SYMBOL_COL10:
00559     com = LCD_SYMBOL_COL10_COM;
00560     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_COL10_SEG;
00561     break;
00562 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DEGC_SEG
00563   case LCD_SYMBOL_DEGC:
00564     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DEGC_COM;
00565     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DEGC_SEG;
00566     break;
00567 #endif
00568 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DEGF_SEG
00569   case LCD_SYMBOL_DEGF:
00570     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DEGF_COM;
00571     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DEGF_SEG;
00572     break;
00573 #endif
00574 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DP2_SEG
00575   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP2:
00576     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP2_COM;
00577     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP2_SEG;
00578     break;
00579 #endif
00580 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DP3_SEG
00581   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP3:
00582     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP3_COM;
00583     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP3_SEG;
00584     break;
00585 #endif
00586 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DP4_SEG
00587   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP4:
00588     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP4_COM;
00589     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP4_SEG;
00590     break;
00591 #endif
00592 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_DP5_SEG
00593   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP5:
00594     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP5_COM;
00595     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP5_SEG;
00596     break;
00597 #endif
00598   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP6:
00599     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP6_COM;
00600     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP6_SEG;
00601     break;
00602   case LCD_SYMBOL_DP10:
00603     com = LCD_SYMBOL_DP10_COM;
00604     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_DP10_SEG;
00605     break;
00606 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_AM_SEG
00607   case LCD_SYMBOL_AM:
00608     com = LCD_SYMBOL_AM_COM;
00609     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_AM_SEG;
00610     break;
00611 #endif
00612 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_PM_SEG
00613   case LCD_SYMBOL_PM:
00614     com = LCD_SYMBOL_PM_COM;
00615     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_PM_SEG;
00616     break;
00617 #endif
00618 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_MICROAMP_SEG
00619   case LCD_SYMBOL_MICROAMP:
00620     com = LCD_SYMBOL_MICROAMP_COM;
00621     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_MICROAMP_SEG;
00622     break;
00623 #endif
00624 #ifdef LCD_SYMBOL_MILLIAMP_SEG
00625   case LCD_SYMBOL_MILLIAMP:
00626     com = LCD_SYMBOL_MILLIAMP_COM;
00627     bit = LCD_SYMBOL_MILLIAMP_SEG;
00628     break;
00629 #endif
00630 
00631   }
00632   if (on)
00633   {
00634     LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00635   }
00636   else
00637   {
00638     LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, false);
00639   }

00643 /**************************************************************************/
00647 void SegmentLCD_Battery(int batteryLevel)
00648 {
00649   uint32_t com, bit;
00650   int      i, on;
00651 
00652   for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00653   {
00654     if (i < batteryLevel)
00655     {
00656       on = 1;
00657     }
00658     else
00659     {
00660       on = 0;
00661     }
00662     com = EFM_Display.Battery.com[i];
00663     bit = EFM_Display.Battery.bit[i];
00664 
00665     if (on)
00666     {
00667       LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, true);
00668     }
00669     else
00670     {
00671       LCD_SegmentSet(com, bit, false);
00672     }
00673   }
00674 }

00677 /**************************************************************************/
00681 void SegmentLCD_Init(bool useBoost)
00682 {
00683 
00684   /* Ensure LE modules are accessible */
00685   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, true);
00686 
00687   /* Enable LFRCO as LFACLK in CMU (will also enable oscillator if not enabled) */
00688   CMU_ClockSelectSet(cmuClock_LFA, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00689 
00690   /* LCD Controller Prescaler  */
00691   CMU_ClockDivSet(cmuClock_LCDpre, LCD_CMU_CLK_PRE);
00692 
00693   /* Frame Rate */
00694   CMU_LCDClkFDIVSet(LCD_CMU_CLK_DIV);
00695 
00696   /* Enable clock to LCD module */
00697   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_LCD, true);
00698 
00699   LCD_DISPLAY_ENABLE();
00700 
00701   /* Disable interrupts */
00702   LCD_IntDisable(0xFFFFFFFF);
00703 
00704   /* Initialize and enable LCD controller */
00705   LCD_Init(&lcdInit);
00706 
00707   /* Enable all display segments */
00708   LCD_SEGMENTS_ENABLE();
00709 
00710   /* Enable boost if necessary */
00711   if (useBoost)
00712   {
00713     LCD_VBoostSet(LCD_BOOST_LEVEL);
00714     LCD_VLCDSelect(lcdVLCDSelVExtBoost);
00715     CMU->LCDCTRL |= CMU_LCDCTRL_VBOOSTEN;
00716   }
00717 
00718   /* Turn all segments off */
00719   SegmentLCD_AllOff();
00720 
00721   LCD_SyncBusyDelay(0xFFFFFFFF);
00722 }
00723 
00724 
00725 /**************************************************************************/
00728 void SegmentLCD_Disable(void)
00729 {
00730   /* Disable LCD */
00731   LCD_Enable(false);
00732 
00733   /* Make sure CTRL register has been updated */
00734   LCD_SyncBusyDelay(LCD_SYNCBUSY_CTRL);
00735 
00736   /* Turn off LCD clock */
00737   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_LCD, false);
00738 
00739   /* Turn off voltage boost if enabled */
00740   CMU->LCDCTRL = 0;
00741 }
